channel.title: Events as Messages :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: It might be becoming clear that in many ways, events are another form of message passing, much like methods are. In fact, they are processed much the same way: the Invoke() method of the event calls each attached event handler in turn. Tip Regular event invocation in C# is synchronous, just as is method calling - invoking an event passes execution to the event handlers one at a time the same way calling a method hands program execution to the method.
